utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll see you at the scene, sexy.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Javier Esposito! When we get to this crime scene, do not wink at me. Do not smile at me. And don’t even look at me with those puppy dog eyes. Got it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon Gina, I’m not having this conversation with you again. Well, I gotta go. I’m at work. It is so work!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s up, Castle? How’s it going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You want my advice? Never sleep with someone you work with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Trust me. It doesn’t end well.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Who knows?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everyone knows.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Everyone knows what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE_ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: On my way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay, Castle? You seem upset.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, I’m fine. Why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The murder is here? At Drake’s Magic Shop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve been coming here since I was thirteen years old. This place is a paradise for boys. Whoopee cushions, magic tricks, fake vomit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not just for boys, Castle. My grandfather was an amateur magician and I used to come here every Sunday afternoon when I was that age, too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I never pegged you for a magic fan. You know any good tricks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I do this one thing. With ice cubes.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: According to his water soaked wallet, the victim is Zalman Drake, the shop owner. His assistant, Eliza Winter, found him in the tank when she opened up the store this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any signs of forced entry?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: You know, it is beyond me why people think this is entertaining. I see a guy hanging upside down in a water tank, I think, “you are a fool”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Huh. You know, the milk cans and the water torture tank, they were real game changers in the magic world. They were the first presentation of real life and death consequences. As the magician held his breath, so did the audience.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, this magician would have had to hold his breath eight to ten hours if he wanted to take a bow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying between twelve and two AM?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks that way. Petechial hemorrhaging in his eyes indicates drowning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Failed escape attempt?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, there’s no redness on his ankles where he was hanging. It doesn’t look like he struggled to get out. I have a feeling he was dead before he hit the water, but I won’t know for sure until I get him back to the lab.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe there’s another reason he struggled. Suicide note. Says he was in financial trouble and couldn’t bear the thought of losing his family’s shop so he was going to kill himself.

utterance.speaker: ELIZA WINTER
utterance.content: Mr. Drake did not kill himself!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: ELIZA
utterance.content: I just know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it true, though? Was he going to lose his shop?

utterance.speaker: ELIZA
utterance.content: No! I mean, yes. But two weeks ago he told me that everything was fine, that he had worked it all out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any idea how? Was there a windfall or an investor?

utterance.speaker: ELIZA
utterance.content: He didn’t say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would he have been able to place himself in that tank?

utterance.speaker: ELIZA
utterance.content: Absolutely. But he wouldn’t have. Not Zalman. He loved and respected magic too much.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Esposito, there’s no signature here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll have CSU run it for prints.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have them run the tank and entries and exits as well.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw him?

utterance.speaker: ELIZA
utterance.content: Yesterday morning. He left right after lunch and he was gone the rest of the day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say where he was going?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was it normal for him to leave the shop in the middle of the day?

utterance.speaker: ELIZA
utterance.content: Yeah, he would do that sometimes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you notice any changes in his behavior? Anything unusual going on in his life?

utterance.speaker: ELIZA
utterance.content: This past month he was gone more often. All he’d say was that he was working on something. But he looked a little tired, like he hadn’t been sleeping.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you think of any reason for the change?

utterance.speaker: ELIZA
utterance.content: Yes. Last month, right before all this started, a guy came into the shop and attacked Mr. Drake. He pushed him right through a display case. He said he better watch his back and he was going to sue him for all he was worth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, I will hold. So court records show that a lawsuit was filed against Zalman Drake a month ago. They’re pulling it up now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. We canvassed the area around the magic shop. One of the neighbors said that she saw an old white van pull up to the shop around midnight and then heard the gate roll up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, you guys look into that and let’s find out where Zalman was disappearing to. I’d like to know what he was doing all the way up until the moment that he died. What about his next of kin?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Only surviving relative is a brother in Poughkeepsie. We haven’t reached him yet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, thank you guys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. X-Ray specs. Got them at the magic shop. I can see you naked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? How do you like my navel ring?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like somebody has a secret.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Secret? What secret?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I understand a guy not wanting to share. I mean, some things are personal.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How did you find out?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Dude, everybody knows. It’s all over page six.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: "Looks like an unhappy ending for the publisher and the mystery writer."

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Apparently he and ex-wife slash girlfriend slash publisher Gina had some words, loud words, at Le Cirque and she stormed off.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s what he was talking about this morning.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What I don’t understand is why he would try to hide it from us. I mean, we’re like family.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe he’s afraid of what we might think.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So it turns out a lawsuit was filed against Zalman Drake by a Jerome Aspenal. And get this, the judge threw it out yesterday.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe Jerome decided to take justice into his own hands. What was he suing him for?

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: Zalman Drake? I was suing him for slander, defamation of character, and ruining my life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how did Zalman do that, Jerome?

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: He read my frigging mind! In front of like, three hundred people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: During a magic performance?

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: Yeah, it was like this mind reading, card tricks, levitation at this chic chic charity ball. My in-laws bought a table and I figured, free food, some entertainment, maybe later I’d get lucky. Turns out, not so lucky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could you elaborate on that?

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: Yeah, this magician, Zalman Drake, gets on stage and makes this rich dude disappear and reappear and I’m like, oh, that’s cool. Then he asks for volunteers. My wife raises my hand and says, go up there, it’ll be fun. So I do. Drake says, stand across from me and think good thoughts. So I do. He looks at me, concentrates, puts his fingers on my forehead and he goes, “you’re thinking of Rita and your trip to Atlantic City last weekend”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Were you?

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: Yeah, but I was trying not to. ‘Cause here’s the kicker –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your wife’s name isn’t Rita.

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: Right. So now I’m living in a motel in Long Island City, my father-in-law fired me, and Rita won’t even talk to me because my wife found her number and called her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you last night between twelve and two?

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: Why is she asking me that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, she wants to know if you have an alibi.

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zalman Drake was murdered last night.

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: Justice is served.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When he read your mind, did it take him very long?

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: No, no it didn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I didn’t think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jerome, we have a witness who says you went to his shop, attacked, and threatened Zalman Drake. When they dropped your lawsuit yesterday, did you decide to take the law into your own hands? Did you go to the magic shop and murder Zalman?

utterance.speaker: JEROME
utterance.content: No, I didn’t go anywhere last night, except for O’Lanahan’s at 57th and 7th. Because thanks to Zalman Drake, I no longer have a wife or mistress to go home to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wonder how Zalman did it. He must have lifted something from Jerome’s pocket with his receipt from his weekend of sin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You had your hand in my pocket and I didn’t even feel it? Do it again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan? Any luck narrowing down Zalman’s whereabouts yesterday?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, not yet. But I did check into Jerome’s whereabouts last night. The barkeep at O’Lanahan’s said he was there until close and then he called him a cab.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the only thing he killed last night was his brain cells.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And a forensics sweep of the water tank came up negative for any prints on the operating apparatus other than Zalman’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So either he committed suicide-

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or the killer wore gloves.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not the whole time. According to the lab, there were fingerprints all over that suicide note and they weren’t Zalman’s or Jerome’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get a match?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, to a Charles ‘Chuck’ Russell. Low-life street magician with three arrests and two convictions, one for arson and another on an explosives charge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he know our victim?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, apparently Zalman is some big muckity-muck with the American’s Magician’s Guild. They have a code of professional conduct and Chuck broke it. He was reckless with pyrotechnics in his act, injured his assistant, so Zalman had him kicked out. He hasn’t been able to book a gig since.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where can we find him?

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: So, I have Brenda’s watch here. She wants me to make her husband disappear. That’s a felony, I can’t do that. But I can make the watch disappear. Give it up.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Thank you, Brenda. Ahh, a dollar. I’ll dine on ramen and tap water tonight and think of you. What about you? You got a little something for the United Magicians College Fund?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, I do. We need to talk to you about Zalman Drake.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Abracadabra.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alakazam, jackass.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Why am I here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You recognize this?

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: That’s a baggie. And that’s a letter. Next.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Careful, Chuckie. Next could be a murder charge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your fingerprints are on it.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So I find it strange that someone else’s fingerprints are on another guy’s suicide note.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your old friend, Zalman Drake.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Zalman?

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s him. He killed himself? Man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found him drowned in the water torture trick in his shop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You must have thought you were pretty clever, staging it to look like botched escape.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: I didn’t stage anything. I had nothing to do with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe you can explain your prints on that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: No, wait.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Okay, listen. I gave him this note.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You gave him a suicide note.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Not that note, the other note on the paper. The one you can’t see. Hold it under a black light.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: It’s an invoice. For services rendered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of services?

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: He wanted me to get him something. Something illegal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C4 explosives?

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Ironic, right? He wants explosives from me when that’s what he got me booted for. But he promised to get me reinstated in the Guild and I wanted to work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoever wrote this note probably thought they took a blank piece of paper.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Whoever being - not me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You provided him with enough C4 to blow up half a city block. What was it for?

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: Maybe it was for a magic trick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon.

utterance.speaker: CHUCK
utterance.content: No, listen. Zalman didn’t just run the shop and do corporate gigs. He was also this genius trick designer. Rumor has it that he was creating cutting edge illusions for the hottest guy out there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who is the hottest guy out there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tobias Strange? He’s the Johnny Depp of magic. I saw him in Vegas. He made a Ferrari disappear.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why would anybody want to do that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh yeah, he’s in town. Saw him perform a couple of weeks ago. Awesome, awesome show. Yeah, we loved it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Me and my buddy. Ray.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You have a buddy named Ray who you went with to a magic show?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. What about it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay guys. Hold Chuck on an explosives trafficking charge and let’s see if this Johnny Depp of magic knew what his trick designer was really into and why it required so much C4.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Hey! This is a private rehearsal! Who the hell let them in here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All access pass.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Zalman has been the heart of the New York magic community since he inherited the shop from his dad. It’s a huge loss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I understand that he worked for you.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Used to. We parted ways last month.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: I heard from one of my vendors that he might be working for someone else. So I confronted him. Turns out, he was poached.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know by whom?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: He didn’t say. Look, Zalman had been my exclusive designer and engineer for fifteen years. He created some of my most famous tricks. If he had had any stage presence, he would have been a world class magician himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it must have been very upsetting to have him leave after all those years. Didn’t that put some of your trade secrets at risk?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: A thinly veiled accusation, Mr. Castle. Of course I was upset. But I never doubted his discretion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Strange, did any of your illusions require the use of an explosive?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: The term ‘smoke and mirrors’ isn’t metaphoric in our business, Detective. Much of misdirection depends on flashes of light.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about C4?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: The key to making something look dangerous is to have complete control over the outcome. C4 is too volatile and unpredictable. It kills.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any idea what Zalman would be using it for?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Nothing magical, I assure you. Have you checked his workshop?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We haven’t come across a workshop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s probably where he’d been disappearing to every day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where it is?

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Ah, you know magicians are about secrets. But whatever he was working on, you’ll probably find there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s an age old story. Magician at the top of his game, angry that his trick designer jumps ship for the competition, kills him instead of letting his trade secrets fall into enemy hands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s magic, Castle. Not the Cold War.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If it’s not the Cold War, why does Zalman need military grade explosives?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Hell, we don’t even know that if it really was murder. For all we know it could have actually been a suicide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Lanie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me guess. It wasn’t a suicide.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It took you two long enough! Where were you? Europe?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Traffic.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Girl, you could’ve used the gumball.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dressed to the nines, in a big hurry… So, where are you going and who’s the lucky victim?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’ll tell you what, Castle. You tell me what’s going on between you and Gina and I’ll tell you where I’m going tonight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He and his girlfriend had a big fight a Le Cirque. It was in the paper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can we talk about the victim, please?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Okay. No water in the lungs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He wasn’t drowned?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Nope. But he was asphyxiated, which sometimes presents the same way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bruising.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Like someone held their hand over his nose and mouth. He was murdered before he was put into the tank.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then his killer took what he thought was a blank piece of paper and typed out the suicide note.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But why kill him that way? I mean, why make it look like a suicide?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cover up the murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The murder, or something bigger involving explosives? We've got to find that workshop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are the picture of a civilized evening at home.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And you are a caveman. Darling, we are your family. Why didn’t you tell us about this? Have you spoken to her? You know, since your PDA?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My-

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Public Display of Anger.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It says you were fighting, Dad. What about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if you must know –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We were fighting about how much we’d been fighting. If you don’t mind, I’d really like to change the subject.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What am I, six? At least pull out a twenty.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I was thinking -

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon Castle, keep up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where are we going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zalman’s workshop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You found it? How?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In his soggy wallet was a soggy metro card. Ryan ran it through the Automated Fare Database. He was travelling from a subway stop near his magic shop to the last stop out in the Bronx.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we’re canvassing the neighborhood. Do we need vests?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No vests. Remember that power outage a couple weeks ago that shut down the subway?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I looked into Zalman’s financials. He hired a town car that day with his credit card and we now have his address.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sure this is the place?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is where they dropped him off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it looks abandoned. Bricked up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, look, look. Footprints.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes… to nowhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what he wanted us to think.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Open sesame.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Zalman’s fortress of solitude.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wow, Castle. My grandfather would have loved this place. Look, he has a guillotine. And an iron maiden! He even had a zig zag box. You know, you would have liked my grandfather. In fact, you remind me of him a little.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m flattered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wheelchair tracks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and they look fairly fresh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he had a visitor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. They look recent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These papers are dated the day he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll have to get CSU to sweep this whole place.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this an accident or art?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, take a look at this. Pages are ripped. Like he didn’t want anyone to know what he was working on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zalman?

utterance.speaker: ZALMAN LOOKALIKE
utterance.content: Who the hell are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Best trick ever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. Keep your hands where I can see them.

utterance.speaker: ZALMAN LOOKALIKE
utterance.content: Woah, woah, woah, woah. What’s going on? Why are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Zalman?

utterance.speaker: ZALMAN LOOKALIKE
utterance.content: Edmund. Edmund Drake.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His brother from Poughkeepsie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a twin.

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: Yeah. Can I put my hands down?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why were you hiding in the iron maiden?

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: It’s the entrance from the other room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m Detective Beckett. We’re here about your brother.

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: So am I. Where is he?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t know?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Drake, I’m sorry to tell you, but your brother is dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? He has an identical twin who wears glasses. That’s the worst disguise since Clark Kent and you believe him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have no reason not to. Look at him. He’s devastated.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s an act! Don’t you ever go to movies? It’s … it’s probably Edmund who’s dead and that dweeb in the next room is Zalman. I bet he killed his brother to take over his life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As an accountant, in Poughkeepsie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well … I …

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: I knew something was wrong when he called me a couple of days ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did he call about?

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: Money. He said someone was paying him a half a million dollars and he needed my help to hide it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hide it how?

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: To make sure that the government never found out where it came from. They way he was talking, it sounded like he had gotten involved in something illegal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what were you doing, at his warehouse?

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: Well… I just had this feeling yesterday that something was terribly wrong. And when I tried to reach him, I couldn’t. I drove down to the city. I think it was a twin thing. You know. All our lives we’ve had this … connection.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, of course. Twin thing. Tell me, Mr. Drake, given your legacy, why didn’t you ever get into the family business, too?

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: I didn’t have the passion, or the skill. Zalman and I, we, uh, we did have an act together, as kids.

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: He would disappear up on stage and then I would appear in the back of the audience. I guess it was only amazing to people who didn’t know we were twins.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you’re being modest. I’m sure you fooled a lot of people.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Drake, the activities your brother was involved in, if you looked through his things do you think you’d be able to determine what he was doing?

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: Zalman was a brilliant engineer and I’m afraid my brain just doesn’t work that way. He was something special, you know? Light up a room. Look, Detective, I don’t know what he got mixed up in, but I just know he didn’t deserve to die.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t believe you’re letting him just walk out of here! If this was a movie …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not a movie. And what am I supposed to charge him with? Being a twin?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Being an evil twin. In a magic murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A half a million dollar payment that he’s hiding from the government? Bricks of C4? That doesn’t sound like magic to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: CSU is finishing their initial sweep. So far we haven’t been able to find anything to indicate who Zalman might have been working for, other than Tobias Strange. But, CSU did find some trace residue of C4 explosives on the workbench.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what about the tracks?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You were right. They are from a wheelchair. The tracks are pretty distinctive. We’re running down make and model now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, with any luck, Professor X will turn out to be Zalman’s mystery client.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right, thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about this? Zalman gets in over his head. He lures his brother down here, suffocates him, sticks him in a tank so it looks like he’s dead. Meanwhile Zalman, as Edmund, inherits his own magic shop, collects his own insurance, all the while takes Edmund's wife and children, who love him, as his own. It’s dead ringer!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you still talking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Edmund is Zalman.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Couldn’t be more wrong. I ran the prints on our victim. He’s Zalman.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Satisfied, Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: More like, disappointed.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Well, maybe this will cheer you up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Old man hair!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: White rabbit fur. Came from his teeth and throat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he was killed by a rabbit who did not want to be pulled out of a hat.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Your guess is as good as mine. In the process of trying to determine how Zalman was asphyxiated, I also discovered the presence of a low dose of organophosphates in his nose and throat.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Organophosphates?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s found in hydraulic fluids. Jet engine oil, insecticides, nerve agents.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nerve agents?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, along with the C4, our magician’s looking more like a terrorist.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The amount is too small to indicate that he was working with them directly, but he definitely was exposed to them recently.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hola, chica. I was in the ‘hood and I thought we should talk about the –

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Tests! That you had me run. They’re in the back. I’ll go get them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What tests?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Different case. Hey, I was just about to call you. You know those wheelchair tracks you found at Zalman’s workshop? Well, they had a saw tooth pattern unique to one brand of tire made for electric wheelchairs. We called half a dozen specialty shops that stock that tire, and we cross referenced recent purchases with the mailing list of the magic shop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get a match?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Thaddeus Magnus. He’s a professional government protester. He’s got multiple arrests for civil disobediences and get this - drives a white van.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Government protester? Civil disobedience? You mix that in with C4 and nerve agent you’re looking at Tim McVeigh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You have an address?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice work.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: That was close.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, this is close.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How does a guy in a wheelchair lift someone into a tank of water?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Magnus. NYPD. Open up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe the wheelchair is an act. In every magic story, there’s an unexpected twist where things aren’t always what they seem. It’s an obligation of the genre.

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. We need to ask you a few questions about Zalman Drake.

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: Zalman Drake of Drake’s Magic. End of an era. I hear it was a failed escape.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: More like a successful murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was asphyxiated before he was lowered into the tank.

utterance.speaker: MAGUS
utterance.content: You mean he was really murdered?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Guess whose van was spotted outside his shop right about when he died?

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: Would you just not touch that, please? Took me five years to build it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was he working on for you? What were the explosives for?

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: Explosives? What are you talking about? Look, Zalman was my friend. He didn’t work for me, I worked for him, making specialty items for those tricks that he designed. Nothing explosive, just things like that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doesn’t change the fact you were at his store when he died.

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: Does it look like I could have lifted him into a tank?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe you borrowed a set of legs. Maybe these, or someone else’s.

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: If anyone killed him, it was those guys he met.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What guys?

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: Those guys he was working for. I was there at the warehouse when they called. I went there to pick up a check for some work I did on a job. They wanted to meet him. Told him to go to the store after closing. Zalman asked me to drop him off. Next thing I hear, he’s dead. I didn’t know it was murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The job that you did for him, what was it?

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: He wanted me to make him a mechanical arm. You know, something to trigger a switch remotely.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Theoretically, what could it trigger?

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: Well, anything. Turn on a light, ring a bell…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Set off a bomb?

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: Look, I swear, I thought he was joking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: MAGNUS
utterance.content: He said this was his greatest magic trick ever. Said he was getting paid a fortune … to get away with murder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you really think someone would hire a magician to help them get away with murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I mean, it’s brilliant really. Magicians are masters at misdirection. If they can manipulate audiences, they can manipulate witnesses. They could even make people testify to things that never happened.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s so hard to believe that a person with that much respect for magic would use his skills to kill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He needed to save his shop, and a half a million dollar payday was too good to be true.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It was, and instead of a payday he got whacked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the people who hired him probably figured it was safer to kill him than to run the risk of having an attack of conscience and rat them out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, so, without evidence how are we going to find them?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By finding out exactly who they hired Zalman to kill. We know he was working on a trick, involving C4 and a remote triggering device.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, whoever he killed went out with a bang.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There can’t have been that many deaths in the tri-state area in the last couple of weeks where someone was killed by an explosion. Where are we with ATF and the fire department?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’re supposed to get their reports in the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, in the meantime let’s see what we can dig up ourselves.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know how many explosions there are in New York City every week? Steam pipe explodes. Gas stove explodes.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Unhappy couple explodes. But didn’t you explode in a rather ritzy restaurant with uh –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah ha. Speak of the devil. You’re not going to answer that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Answer what?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ooh, well done. Of course, making your phone disappear doesn’t make your problems disappear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: C’mon kiddo. What’s going on with you two? Really?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing’s going on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, nothing is all. Everything is fine. Everything is … just fine. It’s ordinary. Problem is, I don’t want ordinary. I want –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Magic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. You know what the problem is? We just aren’t in love. Neither one of us wants to admit … organophosphates.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It wasn’t a nerve agent. It was jet oil. Zalman was at an airport.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What? I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Now you see him, now you don’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. I think I figured out who Zalman was paid to kill.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Billionaire philanthropist Christian Dahl?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you –?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Organophosphates, jet oil, airport.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like we could be twins. Connection.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Conjecture. All we know right now is that Dahl took off from Teterboro Saturday afternoon intending to set a trans-Atlantic speed record in his jet.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Apparently something went wrong and the plane broke up midair. Witnesses out on an oil tanker on Long Island Sound claim to have seen a white flash and smoke in the sky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, a midair explosion would account for all the C4 that Zalman bought from Chuck.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And Magnus’ remote triggering device.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoever wanted Christian dead probably killed Zalman to cover up the crime.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except all we have now is speculation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, I just got off with the FAA. They’re sending over footage of the takeoff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, there’s Dahl getting on his jet for the trans-Atlantic flight attempt. Looks like he’s doing his pre-flight. Look at that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It matches the outline on the wall in Zalman’s workshop. He was painting a decal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Zoom in on that guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s Zalman Drake.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s dressed like a caterer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Probably so he could get past security. He delivered something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, explosives and a triggering device. This was a murder for hire. Skip ahead and …. freeze it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He planned for Christian Dahl’s plane to break up over the Atlantic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s the perfect crime. No evidence.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No body.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you crazy? I’ve never even tried anything like that. Yeah, okay, yeah. Me too. ‘Bye.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who was that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Coast Guard. I was just seeing if they, uh, found the plane’s data recorder.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did they?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Did they what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey guys! Where are you on Christian Dahl?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy is unbelievable. He became a billionaire by always being in exactly the right place at exactly the right time to invest in whatever stock, product, or idea was just about to hit.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he have any enemies? Anyone that was threatening him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, all the people I talked to loved him. He gave away more money than Oprah and he gave a lot of money to research into the occult.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He climbed Everest, he flew across Europe in a hot air balloon, he even drove a dogsled in the Iditarod.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, with that much going for him he had to have had a couple of haters.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just one. And she had both motive and opportunity.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Naomi Weldon?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Naomi Weldon Dahl. Christian’s wife and former fashion model. Apparently, a month ago, Christian caught her having an affair and according to their prenup, if he divorced her she wound up with nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if he dies, she inherits billions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where was this photo taken?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, you noticed. The Dahl Foundation Benefit six weeks ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And the entertainment for the evening was …?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zalman Drake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Jerome did say Zalman made someone disappear that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Naomi sees his performance and wonders if Zalman can make her husband disappear forever.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And with billions on the line –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Half a million is just chump change.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: When they told me Christian’s plane disappeared, that’s exactly what I thought.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That your husband’s death was no accident.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: Christian was a perfectionist. And he was superstitious. He did three background checks before he married me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You and your husband had an airtight prenuptial agreement.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: Standard when two high profile people marry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if you left the marriage or had an affair, you’d be leaving the marriage without spousal or child support.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: Those were the terms. I have my own career. I can take care of myself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you were having an affair.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: Whether or not I had an affair is none of your affair. If you’re implying I murdered my husband to be with someone else, you’re mistaken. I wouldn’t kill anyone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not even to inherit a fortune?

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: Well, then the joke would be on me. There is no fortune. All of Christian’s accounts have been frozen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean you’re in probate.

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: No, I mean frozen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: NAOMI
utterance.content: You’ll have to ask the district attorney’s office. God knows they wouldn’t tell me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That was the DA. Apparently, at the time of his death, our billionaire investment guru was being investigated by the SEC. They thought he was making his money the old fashioned way. By stealing it. All of his amazing stock returns were falsified. The whole thing was a Ponzi scheme. As it turns out, they were a couple of weeks away from indicting Christian Dahl for massive fraud. He was going to lose everything and face fifty years in federal prison.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If I were him I’d want to disappear too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what better way to disappear…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: …than to hire a magician?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bingo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Christian Dahl is on his plane doing his preflight check. Zalman leaves the plane. Dahl taxis to the runway and takes off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he had to have gotten off at some point, otherwise it would be a suicide mission, and you don’t need a magician for that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless … … that isn’t Christian Dahl.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks just like him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Dummy. Not you. The … one … in the cockpit. They switched out real Dahl for dummy Dahl. Magnus didn’t build a triggering device for an explosion. The arm he built was for doing the preflight checks. The whole thing is an automaton. That’s the magic trick. He made it look to the world like Christian Dahl was still on the plane the same way Tobias Strange made it look like he was still in the cabinet when the swords went in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he used the catering box to get the dummy on board and Christian Dahl off. Then who’s piloting that plane?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Christian Dahl. Only not from the cockpit. He had it rigged to fly by remote control. See? Zalman puts the box in the van. There’s probably a console on there linked to the plane’s avionics. Dahl takes off remotely, flies out over the Atlantic –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then he detonates the explosion and everyone thinks that he’s dead because everyone’s seen him on board.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only Dahl is very much alive and there’s only one person in the world that knows it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Zalman. And as long as he’s alive he’s a threat to Dahl.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Dahl has to tie up that one loose end.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But he can’t risk anyone knowing that he’s still alive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Dahl has to kill Zalman himself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. So what do we do now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it’s four days since the accident. Christian Dahl is probably in some non-extradition country with a chunk of his fortune by now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, probably. Unless …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, Dahl does everything publicly. The guy loves being famous. Everyone thinks he’s dead. A guy like that … no, it’s crazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, crazy is exactly what we need right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, this is crazy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crazy, but in character. Look at the kind of guy Christian Dahl was, how he loved the limelight, his fascination with life after death. You think a guy like that is going to miss the opportunity to attend his own funeral?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not a chance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay so, if he’s here, how do we find him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, he’ll be in disguise of course. Look for an anomaly. Someone who is trying to fit in, yet sticking to the outskirts. Someone who isn’t engaging in conversation, but at the same time eavesdropping on other people’s conversations. Someone who’s –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Got long hair, a beard, and thousand dollar shoes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’ll work too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Dahl.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Should’ve stayed dead, bro.

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: So I faked my own death. So what? That’s not a crime. What are you going to charge me with? Littering the Atlantic? I’ll stand in line behind BP.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The charge is premeditated murder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We figured out your little trick. Zalman performed for your charity event, he made you disappear. Giving you the inspiration to pull the ultimate escape. You knew he needed money, so you made him an offer he couldn’t refuse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you never planned on paying him, did you Mr. Dahl? You planned on using his desperation over the loss of his family’s legacy to make people think that he committed suicide.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Staging a shooting is too cumbersome. Too many questions. Where did the gun come from? So you used what you had on hand to get rid of the only person on Earth who knew you were still alive. Once he was gone you’d be free and clear.

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: Is this what you do when you can’t solve a crime? Concoct fantasies?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The rabbit hair that lined your gloves was found on our victim. You called Zalman, met him at his shop, put your gloved hand over his mouth and then you smothered him.

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: If you think I’m afraid of you or the SEC, I will beat your pants off and enjoy every minute of it. Assuming you can find me once I’m out on bail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not me you should be scared of, Mr. Dahl, or the SEC. You should be afraid of what you’ve become.

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: Once you’re done with your lecture and your petty threats, I’d like to see my –

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: - my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something wrong, Dahl?

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Christian?

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: How are you doing that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Doing what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is he having flashbacks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: Do you see him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: See who?

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: He was right here. Oh God. You can’t be here.

utterance.speaker: DAHL
utterance.content: You’re dead. I … I killed you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alakazam, jackass.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you know that would work?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I didn’t. Just knew he’d lawyer up, so I figured why not take a shot?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your grandfather would be proud.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you so much, gentlemen.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Always a pleasure to lend a hand to the NYPD. I might add this one to my repertoire, as a tribute to your brother.

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: Thank you, Detective, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what’s going to happen to Drake’s Magic Shop?

utterance.speaker: EDMUND
utterance.content: Tobias and I were discussing it. Zalman put his life on the line for it, so we’d like to find a way to keep it alive.

utterance.speaker: TOBIAS
utterance.content: Maybe we can pull a solution out of our collective hats.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Goodnight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, could you …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So … where’s Esposito?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ha, take a wild guess.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT_CASTLE
utterance.content: Lanie?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Can you believe they still think none of us know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, let’s let them keep thinking that a little while longer. The bubble’ll burst soon enough.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not if you’re in it with the right person. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me, I need to take this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no. What I’m saying is, it’s over.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Heading out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s late.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Motorcycle Boy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I really wish you would stop calling him that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doctor Motorcycle Boy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s on shift tonight. I was going to see if I could catch the comfort food truck. You want to come?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Macaroni and cheese? Warm biscuits? Hot chocolate? How could I say no? Hey, I wanted to say thanks, for, um… not mentioning that article or asking what was going on.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No problem.
